description:
# nova-manage floating create 192.168.1.1
# nova-manage floating create 192.168.1.1

# nova-manage floating list 
None	192.168.1.1	None	nova	eth0
None	192.168.1.1	None	nova	eth0

* Floating IPs should be unique.
title: [Floating IPs] It is possible to create the same IP address with nova-manage floating create

comments.content:
# nova-manage floating create 192.168.1.1
# nova-manage floating create 192.168.1.1

# nova-manage floating list 
None	192.168.1.1	None	nova	eth0
None	192.168.1.1	None	nova	eth0

* Floating IPs should be unique.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~davidnaori3

comments.content: I was able to replicate this
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~zulcss

comments.content: See attached file for a suggested solution for this defect.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~bao-mingyan

comments.content:
This appears to be fixed in upstream nova:

dan@devstack:~$ nova add-floating-ip fooserver2 172.24.4.225
ERROR: floating ip is already associated (HTTP 400) (Request-ID: req-aabe7c72-c31c-433f-ac44-529d92baa5b7)
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~danms

comments.content: Dan: the bug report is about creating floating ips not adding them to a server. See the repro steps in the report
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~vishvananda

comments.content:
Fix proposed to branch: master
Review: https://review.openstack.org/11022
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hudson-openstack
